title: Define Project Requirements
description: Gather and document the requirements for the AdaptiveLearningPathCreator system, including user personas, goals, features, constraints, and non-functional requirements such as performance, scalability, security, accessibility, usability, and maintainability. Identify stakeholders and conduct interviews or workshops to gather requirements. Ensure to cover requirements related to the AI-driven personalization engine (including data input/output formats, training data sources, models), user interface (UI/UX design considerations), data management (data storage, retrieval, and privacy policies), integration with coding platforms or resources, API documentation, test cases, and any other relevant aspects. Provide clear and concise documentation for each requirement, including rationale, dependencies, and acceptance criteria. In addition, it would be beneficial to consider potential future expansions of the system, such as support for multiple programming languages or integration with additional learning resources. Lastly, ensure that the documentation is easily accessible and updated as the project progresses. For this RFC, include a section detailing the data flow through the system and any specific technical requirements for the AI-driven engine, particularly for handling large amounts of user data in a secure and efficient manner. Also, consider including use cases to help illustrate how the system will function. Additionally, provide clear guidelines for the AI-driven engine regarding fairness, transparency, and accountability. Lastly, include a section on performance metrics and key indicators to evaluate the effectiveness of the personalized learning paths. Update the rfc_state field to 'READY_FOR_APPROVAL' once the task is ready. Please assign this RFC to the Project Manager for further action.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, and integration points. Key aspects include: 1) User management and authentication (e.g., role-based access control, user profiles), 2) Skill assessment and coding challenge engine (e.g., problem statement management, submission handling, automated testing), 3) Learning path generation algorithm (e.g., user profiling, content mapping, personalization techniques), 4) Content management system for learning resources (e.g., course materials, tutorials, practice exercises), 5) User progress tracking and reporting (e.g., performance metrics, learning analytics), 6) Scalability and performance considerations (e.g., load balancing, caching, asynchronous processing, microservices architecture), 7) Integration with third-party services (e.g., authentication providers, coding platforms, APIs for content delivery), 8) Security and data privacy measures (e.g., encryption at rest and in transit, access controls, secure storage of sensitive information, data retention policies), 9) Deployment and infrastructure requirements (e.g., cloud or on-premises, containerization, CI/CD pipelines), 10) Monitoring and logging strategies (e.g., error handling, application health monitoring, audit trails, log aggregation tools), 11) Edge cases, error handling, and performance optimizations (e.g., validation checks, caching strategies for frequently accessed data, efficient database queries), 12) Unit and integration testing considerations (e.g., test coverage targets, testing frameworks), 13) Containers/orchestration strategy (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), 14) Design of data models and schema, 15) API design for internal components communication, 16) Disaster recovery and business continuity planning, 17) Accessibility considerations (e.g., ensuring the platform is usable by users with different abilities).
